paper.title: Trees, automata, and games
paper.venue: Symposium on the Theory of Computing
paper.abstract: In 1969 Rabin introduced tree automata and proved one of the deepest decidability results. If you worked on decision problems you did most probably use Rabinu0027s result. But did you make your way through Rabinu0027s cumbersome proof with its induction on countable ordinals? Building on ideas of our predecessors-u0026-mdash;and especially those of B-u0026-uuml;chi-u0026-mdash;we give here an alternative and transparent proof of Rabinu0027s result. Generalizations and further results will be published elsewhere.
